author: Bill Schweber
description:
Explore UVA's breakthrough in heat transfer using hexagonal boron nitride to improve electronics cooling.

The post Evanescence Approach Dramatically Improves Solid-Surface Heat Transfer appeared first on EE Times.
title: Evanescence Approach Dramatically Improves Solid-Surface Heat Transfer

author: News Desk
description:
U.S. manufacturing sector contracted in April for the second month in a row. Shortages were reported for electronic components and semiconductors.

The post Manufacturing Sector Contracted Further in April  appeared first on EE Times.
title: Manufacturing Sector Contracted Further in April

description:

description:
The next generation of e-paper displays, powered by Ynvisible: applications, manufacturing and driving Ynvisible manufactures and commercializes printed, low-power, cost-efficient e-paper displays that can be integrated into smart labels, indicators, digital signage, and much more. These thin, flexible displays support a wide range of form factors and are produced using screen printing, which reduces manufacturing […]

The post The Next Generation of e-Paper Displays, Powered by Ynvisible: Applications, Manufacturing and Driving appeared first on EE Times.
title: The Next Generation of e-Paper Displays, Powered by Ynvisible: Applications, Manufacturing and Driving

description:
This paper discusses and investigates the key characteristics of standard rectifier diodes, fast recovery diodes, Schottky diodes, and silicon carbide (SiC) diodes in power conversion applications. A particular focus is placed on the static and dynamic current imbalance characteristics of fast recovery diodes under parallel operation. The analysis is further validated through corresponding experiments, thus providing valuable insights for power supply design engineers to achieve reliable engineering designs.

The post Analysis of Parallel Application of Power Diodes appeared first on EE Times.
title: Analysis of Parallel Application of Power Diodes
